ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: From this course I learned the ins and outs of deep learning techniques, their applications, and what can be done to improve them. I also learned the hardware applications for neural networks.
This was a great overview course on neural networks. I really feel like I understand them and have the tools to make my own to solve problems.
I learned about the theory behind neural networks, how to implement them, and the hardware behind machine learning today.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course has the strengths of the assignments give us insight to the code that goes into constructing these models in PyTorch. And it allows you to learn as much as you want to. The only weakness is the midterm was based on "understanding what we covered" so it was hard to prepare for success on that.

strengths: 
- you learn a lot
- professor and TA were always really helpful and super responsive to emails

weaknesses:
- disorganization in terms of deadlines... stuff wasn't really clear until after midterm and some due dates of major assignments i felt were on the air
- the midterm was fair and i think it is NECESSARY but i felt it was a very bad move to say there was going to be a midterm AFTER add/drop period closed. many people chose this class because there wasn't a midterm.
I feel like the course structure was very disorganized, the schedule and assignments were changing every week. So some things surprised us, like having a midterm.

The homeworks were formatted very well as they focused on coding in Python and the files contained the correct output of the homework. The answers made us stop and deeply think on how to debug. The course also has a final project similar to a research paper and I found it to be a very good assignment that greatly improved my understanding of neural networks.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this class as a good 400-level EE elective, or for anyone in cognitive science or any field where they may be interested in the applications of Neural networks. It does not require prerequisite engineering knowledge.
No, a lot of assignments and inconsistent workload
Yes! If you are interested in machine learning, especially the hardware aspects, then this is an excellent course to take.
